DOC.HEADLINE: METROPOLITAN DIGEST / LOS ANGELES COUNTY NEWS IN BRIEF : SANTA FE SPRINGS ; PLAN TO CLEAN_UP CHEMICAL COMPANY SITE UNVEILED
DOC.TEXT: State and federal environmental officials have unveiled a plan for cleaning_up contaminated soil and ground_water at a Santa Fe Springs chemical company . The California Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency are proposing that Phibro-Tech Inc. pump and treat ground_water to remove contaminants , including cadmium , chromium and trichloroethane . The agencies propose that Phibro-Tech investigate and , if necessary , clean_up volatile contaminants in the soil . The plan also calls_for monitoring soil and ground_water , covering any unpaved portions of the site to prevent contact with contaminated soil , repairing the site cover , constructing a berm around the perimeter of the facility and restricting property use to prevent any school or residential developments . The public may comment on the proposed cleanup plan by submitting written comments by Dec . 30 to Cal-EPA , or by attending a Dec . 13 community meeting . The meeting will begin at 7 p.m. at the Los Nietos Community and Senior_Citizens Services in Whittier . Phibro-Tech , a division of CP Chemicals Inc. of New Jersey , is in an industrial area at 8851 Dice Road in Santa Fe Springs . The company produces a variety of inorganic chemicals used in the aerospace and electronics_industries and also stores and treats off-site generated hazardous waste from those facilities .
